text: was a Japanese athlete. She was best known as a figure skater.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "Etsuko Inada" ; retrieved 2012-7-25. Inada won the Japan Figure Skating Championships seven times. Inada was a member of the Japan national team at the 1936 Winter Olympics. At age 12, She was the youngest Japanese competitor in all Olympic games.SR/Olympics, "Japan" ; retrieved 2012-7-25. ==Competitive highlights== * Winter Olympic Games, 1936 * World Figure Skating Championships, 1936 * European Figure Skating Championships, 1936 * Japan Figure Skating Championships, 1934-1935, 1936-1951 ==Other websites== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== Category:Sportspeople from Osaka Category:1924 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Japanese figure skaters
title: Etsuko Inada
